definitions.text: a social class comprising those who do manual labor or work for wages
examples: there is a shortage of skilled labor in this field

definitions.text: productive work (especially physical work done for wages)
examples: his labor did not require a great deal of skill

definitions.text: concluding state of pregnancy; from the onset of contractions to the birth of a child
examples: she was in labor for six hours

definitions.text: an organized attempt by workers to improve their status by united action (particularly via labor unions) or the leaders of this movement
a political party formed in Great Britain in 1900; characterized by the promotion of labor's interests and formerly the socialization of key industries
the federal department responsible for promoting the working conditions of wage earners in the United States; created in 1913
any piece of work that is undertaken or attempted
strive and make an effort to reach a goal
examples: She tugged for years to make a decent living
We have to push a little to make the deadline!
She is driving away at her doctoral thesis
She was digging away at her math homework
